text: Nguyễn Thị Bình (born Nguyễn Châu Sa; 26 May 1927) is a Vietnamese communist leader. She negotiated at the Paris Peace Conference on behalf of the Viet Cong, or National Front for the Liberation of South Vietnam. She was born in Saigon. During the Vietnam War, she became a member of the Viet Cong's Central Committee and a vice-chairperson of the South Vietnamese Women's Liberation Association. ==References== Category:1927 births Category:Living people Category:Vice presidents of Vietnam Category:People from Ho Chi Minh City
title: Nguyễn Thị Bình
